rating_action_basis: The affirmation of Hong Leong Investment Bank Berhad’s (HLIB or the Bank) financial institution ratings (FIRs) is premised on its strategic role as Hong Leong Financial Group’s (HLFG or the Group) investment banking and stockbroking arm.
rating_drivers_negative: Inherently volatile earnings
Modest investment banking and stockbroking franchise
rating_triggers_downgrade: The Bank’s ratings will be downgraded if the Group’s ratings are lowered or if the Bank’s importance to the Group diminishes.
related_criteria: Banking Quarterly Roundup (1Q 2023), June 2023
Banking Insight: On Steady Footing, March 2023
Group Rating Methodology for Banks, June 2015
Financial Institutions, December 2008

rating_action_basis: RAM Ratings has assigned an AA1/Stable rating to the proposed Tranche 3 issuance from Hong Leong Investment Bank Berhad’s (HLIB or the Bank) existing unrated RM1 bil Multi-Currency Tier-2 Subordinated Notes Programme (2014/2039) (the Programme).
rating_drivers_negative: Volatile earnings.
rating_triggers_downgrade: The issue rating will be downgraded if the Group’s ratings are lowered or if the Bank’s importance to the Group diminishes.
Upside potential: As HLIB’s FIRs are already the highest on our rating scale, the AA1 issue rating is also the highest for a subordinated debt instrument.
esg_descriptor: Banks indirectly exposed to environmental and social risks. Banks’ exposure to environmental and social risks stems primarily from investments or financing exposures to borrowers in various economic sectors, misconduct in marketing and customer privacy.
related_criteria: Banking Quarterly Roundup (4Q 2023), March 2024
Banking Insight: Staying the Course, March 2024
Group Rating Methodology for Banks, June 2015
FAQ: Methodology for Rating Bank Securities, May 2015
Rating Bank Securities, November 2013
Financial Institutions, December 2008
